fieldDescription: Select which types of heavy industry are ignored when calculating negating factors. 'Tech-Mining' ignores MINING and TECHMINING.

defaultValue: Negating factors that disable Luddic Majority bonuses

fieldDescription:
Enabled: "The faithful turn away from worlds scarred by mankind's excess; such places remind them of the sins that called the Great Collapse."

Disabled: "Even scarred lands may still be welcomed by those seeking refuge; pollution does not sway the devoted."

Enabled: "Great furnaces and automated forges are monuments to mankind's pride - the very hubris Ludd taught us to abandon."

Disabled: "The faithful are willing to coexist with industry; toil and iron need not deter them entirely."

Enabled: "Without simple rural work, the colony feels rootless, detached from the humble labors that honor Ludd's example."

Disabled: "Even in the absence of traditional work, the faithful can find purpose among other labors."

Enabled: "A world where life struggles to exist is taken as a sign: some places were not meant for humanity to tame, but to respect from afar."

Disabled: "Harsh conditions are no barrier; the faithful may still endure where others falter."

Enabled: "Kato's policies actively suppress the Luddic faithful, keeping their influence from spreading to the colony."

Disabled: "Kato's measures are insufficient to deter the faithful; they continue to gather and grow despite his policies."
